column5: isolunar - greatest guide of all time
White spinnerbait.
My boat....
HDS units and Minnkotta Terrova with I-Pilot  makes things much easier out there!
I second that.  NoaaB Buoys app, Navionics and pictures. nuff said.  lol
The carp alarm that attaches to my bank stick...  It allows my to doze off for a few zzzzzzzzzs and not miss a hit or lose my rod and reel...
What is this Bassomatic?  I tried looking it up on Google and all I get are videos of Dan Acroyd putting fish in a blender...
The happy troller trolling plate !!!! And downriggers
You'll have to look it up if you really want to see awesome craftsmanship and the finest in fish catching technology circa 2005-2007.  It was called, the "PikeSlayerinator."  Just saying.
That is it!  LoL  Classic skit!

Coolest Gadget for me (probably because it's the newest addition) is my Remote Golight Spotlight..these things are ridiculously bright and with the spot light attachment I'll be able to see the full width of the channel I follow into the marsh at 3 am  I mounted it at the bow on a custom ram mount extension and wired it with a TM plug right to one of my TM batteries.. No more holding up heavy spot lights over my head!
RPM control buttons on my Yamaha.... Lets me fine tune my trolling speeds and slow way down...
Right now its my Humminbird 571HD DI portable. She's a beaut
I've got a TrollMaster Pro2 for my Yamaha T8 kicker..  So nice to be able to dial in the speed you want all from the front without needing another full set of controls for the motor.
my diy sharpie highlighter turned into a jumbo wacky tool for 7" senkos
Just googled it...  Very cool add on....

My Mercury Mercmonitor Smartcraft gauges let me do the same. It's awesome!!!! I also would be lost without GPS and Minnkota Powerdrive with universal sonar, auto pilot and co-pilot is great too. One of those I-Pilot Terrovas would be even better!!!!
I change mine to my inflatable boat. Love it.
Theres lots of gadgets out there these days.. of all the trinkets you have whats your favourite??
It's not super special or cool but I've been loving my non-digital scale that I just got.
That thing that allows me to move my canoe without moving my arms....Trolling motor!
Definitely this.
Not a big deal really, but I think the rod socks I bought last year have made life much simpler now that I can haul  my rods outta the locker without everything getting tangled up anymore.
Take the TV fishing do we? I have a few of those long things with cork handles!
Electric Fillet Knive....nuff said
Well I can't say I own it but the best "fishing gadget" I have at my disposal is the networking I have available to me here on OFC!
I-Pilot and Tie-Fast knot tying tool
my ELECTRIC downriggers.
my fly rods, when I get the fish dialed in on gear I'll switch to the fly and make all the bait fishermen jealous LOL
at the dash and the 597 up front. That Side Imaging is so cool it's a distraction to actually fishing
Call me sentimental but it used to be my bottle opener.

I-pilot with trolling motor is by far the most expensive favourite gadget but the boomerang clip line cutter is by far th bast bang for buck I have on the boat. Those rod socks are a close second though
My bow mount minn kota with the co pilot (remote control).  Move anywhere I want on the boat & still operate the troller!  Best gadget $$$ can buy!
My digital baitcasters, calais and calcutta, never have i casted in head on wind and watched the reel fire the bait out a mile.
My kids rocket fishing rod, that thing is awesome!
Deer Fly Patch on the back of my hat and my hand held GPS.
Bassomatic  Love it
GPS for sure.  S.
Submersible led lights on the trailer.   Art

My smart phone. The coolest fishing gadget ever!  GPS - Explore new areas, find my way back to the car/boat launch, find the nearest Timmies/tackle shop! send/receive photos send/receive fishing related calls Charge my spoons with the flash. Look up techniques on the water -  When I'm not catching anything I'll try anything. Look up knots - I always forget lesser used knots like the nail knot. Look up water levels and fishing reports. Weather radar. Basically the entire knowledge base of the internet in the palm of my hand.
Coast split ring pliers. Best ones I have used or owned yet. It's a must have for any muskie fishing.
Ron, those look like they belong in any boat regardless of species
